headline: Ohio governor signs permitless concealed carry bill
author: Reid Wilson
sentences:
Mike DeWine (R) has signed legislation allowing residents to carry concealed firearms without a permit, the latest in a string of states to authorize what supporters of gun rights call “constitutional carry.”
The measure, approved by the state’s Republican-controlled legislature last month, will allow residents over the age of 21 to carry a weapon without undergoing training or a background check.
